sentences: Ta on targem kui ta n채eb v채lja.
Tema lapsep천lves oli targem kui praegu.
K천ige targem laps klassis oli alati tema.
context: The word 'targem' is the comparative form of 'targe' (intelligent/smart) in Estonian. It means 'smarter' or 'more intelligent/wiser' when comparing two people or things. The suffix '-m' indicates this comparative degree, similar to adding '-er' in English.
